[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Campus Connect system defines requirements to enhance student engagement and campus resource accessibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Campus Connect supports resource booking, event management, and student interactions to improve the campus experience.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Campus Connect integrates with authentication systems, calendars, and event platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Campus Connect provides web and mobile interfaces for students, faculty, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Campus Connect operates on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Campus Connect supports APIs for integration with third-party services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Campus Connect uses secure HTTPS protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Optimized for efficient memory usage and high-traffic scenarios.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Campus Connect ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Configurable for various campus layouts and operational needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Campus Connect connects to library systems and extracurricular platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Campus Connect facilitates resource booking, event registration, interactive student features, and academic resource sharing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for students, faculty, and administrators with basic technical skills.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Campus Connect depends on stable network connectivity, timely system updates, and operational authentication systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Campus Connect requires integration with campus tools and adherence to institutional standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Campus Resources: Facilities like libraries, labs, and sports areas.
Interactive Features: Includes discussion boards, event notifications, and peer collaboration tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication systems for secure user access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize with calendars for event scheduling, automated reminders, and availability tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to book campus resources like study rooms and labs (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable event organizers to manage registrations and send notifications (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a responsive design compatible with multiple devices.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The user interface shall support multilingual functionality.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process booking requests within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 2,000 concurrent users during peak hours.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store resource booking data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access and data retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular architecture principles for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with institutional security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with WCAG 2.1 for accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet ISO 27001 standards for data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on user demand.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and audit critical activities.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional testing shall validate system modules, performance benchmarks, and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, and developer resources.
[SEC] 5. References: WCAG 2.1 guidelines, ISO 27001 standards, and campus IT documentation.
